DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluate local control rate well acute late toxicity rate stereotactic body radiotherapy ( SBRT ) treatment benign malignant head neck tumor .
DOC.brief_title: Stereotactic Body Radiotherapy Head Neck Tumors
DOC.detailed_description: This single site , non-randomized , prospective , phase IV study include 3 patient group treat SBRT : - Benign tumor , paraganglioma , chordoma , chondrosarcoma , sole treatment gross residual disease maximal safe resection - Malignant tumor , nasopharynx cancer squamous cell carcinoma , initial external beam radiation ( Residual Disease Group ) - Unresectable malignant tumor , nasopharynx cancer squamous cell carcinoma , adenocarcinoma , sarcomas recurrent prior radiation ( Primary RT Group ) Data collect include baseline patient demographic , pathology data , radiation therapy procedure , tumor recurrence data , toxicity . Follow data collect patient 's standard office visit . The anticipated duration study 5 year .
DOC.criteria: Patient age > 18 year Zubrod performance status 03 Benign head neck tumor paragangliomas , chordoma , chondrosarcoma Malignant head neck cancer invasive squamous cell carcinoma , adenocarcinoma , nasopharyngeal carcinoma , salivary gland cancer , sarcoma Signed studyspecific consent form Pregnant lactate woman , due potential exposure fetus RT unknown effect RT lactate female Patients psychiatric addictive disorder would preclude obtain informed consent
